Posted By: ROBRAM89 (12/19/2010 9:41:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/5 trample for 3 cmc (that isn't even intensive, meaning it can be splashed) is too powerful to come without a cost, and thus the sacrificing drawback. However, black is not without ways to deal with this; if your opponent blasts it with a kicked Urza's Rage or something else that hits for an absurd amount of damage, just use Bloodthrone Vampire (or the equivalent) to sacrifice it, therefore causing the spell to fizzle without a target. The rulings say that sacrificing it won't prevent you from having to sac other permanents, although this refers to sacrificing it for its own effect, not another one (failing that, just Fling it if you're running red, too).  
Great card to run, IF you have the means to back it up and get rid of it when it needs to go. 5/5
posts.html:

The rulings say that sacrificing it won't prevent you from having to sac other permanents, although this refers to sacrificing it for its own effect, not another one (failing that, just Fling it if you're running red, too).
Great card to run, IF you have the means to back it up and get rid of it when it needs to go. 5/5
